creator: jdhancock@parker.com
text:
Since Tomcat 5 no longer compiles JSP pages, and JSPC.BAT is not included in 
Tomcat distribution, where can a JSPC.BAT or JSPC.EXE be downloaded so JSP 
pages can be compiled?  (WINDOWS).
What else can I say: RTFM.
creator: remm@apache.org
jdhancock@parker.com
text:
Why is this invalid?  If you aren't going to address the problem, why not 
recommend a server that does compile JSP's or someone who offers a jsp 
compiler?  If you're not part of the solution... you're part of the problem!
Now I know why dot net has the market share.

Come back when what you write makes sense, and try reading the documentation. BZ
is not a user support forum. Thanks.
creator: remm@apache.org
jdhancock@parker.com
text: No assistance given.  Valid issue, invalid support staff.

In case you did not know RTFM stands for read the f___ing manual.  What he is 
saying is that if you read the manual you will find the answer to your 
question.  As this is a question not a bug.  In the future you might want to go 
to the tomcat users list to ask these kind of things.
creator: jakarta@trollingers.com
